website_summaries.verdict: Well-designed and super sturdy helmet if you want to invest in a piece of gear.
pros: Adjustment mechanisms help you get a personalized fit
Removable chin bar makes it versatile for many activities
Lots of ventilation for comfort and air flow
ASTM-certified both with and without the chin bar
cons: Some users share that they cannot hear as well with it on, but it does not interfere enough to be a deal breaker

customer_reviews.title: Really good quality helmet for racing and downhill use, but covers the ears even with the face guard removed.
customer_reviews.text: Grate product. Pro's: 1.) Fits well, and has adjustment mechanisms to fit the head. 2.) Internal pads are comfortable, and to some degree adjustable, removable, and washable. 3.) Has a removable face guard for alternate amounts of protection and visibility. Easy to remove and replace the face guard. 4.) Breathable with lots of ventilation for hot environments. 5.) Certified. Con's: 1.) Very expensive. 2.) Hinders the sense of hearing to a very small degree even with the face guard removed, this may also be a negative style point for some people.
customer_reviews.author: Gadget

customer_reviews.title: Feels solid.
customer_reviews.text: I love it! I got the medium size. It's very snug to put on, but once on, it's a comfortable fit. The matte Dazzle looks really cool, just like the battleships from WW1 that had dazzle camo. The perspective might look odd in the picture, but that's due to the dazzle pattern. Comes with replacement pads, an extra visor with a mount, and a thin bag. Helmet itself feels like it could survive a major accident. I'll update my review if I have any problems or insights down the road.
customer_reviews.author: impressed

customer_reviews.title: Extremely well made and offers incredible protection. Don't plan on drinking - chin guard is impossible to put on alone
customer_reviews.text: Extremely well made and offers incredible protection. The reason for only three stars is that it is too heavy for me to wear and the (very clever) removable chin guard is impossible to put on without a mirror or other person. Maybe it was designed with the idea of removing the helmet every time you want a drink or being used only with a water tube, which I don't use. Since taking off the helmet entirely is an ordeal given all its extra safety snaps and if you wear glasses etc., it means that I no longer use this very expensive product
customer_reviews.author: Zreview

customer_reviews.title: Great light weight helmet
customer_reviews.text: Bought this helmet to protect my head for jet ski freestyle. Really like the mechanism to tighten around your head, but can be tricky with wet hands. Overall this helmet has held up pretty darn well with the water. Not a DOT helmet, but that was not the purpose of me getting this. It was to protect my head in the event a jet ski fell on while doing flips. I like the removable chin piece although I use it just to make taking the helmet on and off easier. I typically do not ride without it.
customer_reviews.author: DoctorMasterBlaster

customer_reviews.title: The face guard comes on and off easily, but once it "clicks" in
customer_reviews.text: I went with the switchblade so that I could have the luxury of using this helmet when I'm riding aggressive down hill (face guard on) as well as leisurely around town (face guard off). The face guard comes on and off easily, but once it "clicks" in, it's not going anywhere. Until riding with it and getting thirsty, I didn't realize the adjustable face guard would make drinking water from my jug more convenient. I don't fully remove my face guard to hydrate, just unlock and lift up on the hinge and you've got access to your mouth.
customer_reviews.author: Jalyn

customer_reviews.title: Smaller and lighter
customer_reviews.text: I have an old Giro Remedy helmet, circa 2010, that is still functional. But after receiving this Giro Switchblade, I cannot but help comment on how the Switchblade is so much lighter, and significantly smaller, than the Remedy. The Remedy looks like a diving bell helmet in comparison (and probably weights as much). The Switchblade in black pairs the best with silver mirrored goggles, in my opinion. Air flow is restricted on this, and any helmet, when a goggle is used in conjunction with a full face helmet for cross country mountain biking. But that's okay, will monitor my heat index.
customer_reviews.author: a brother in Christ

customer_reviews.title: Really cool looking helmet with premium fit and construction.
customer_reviews.text: I have gotten many compliments on how cool this helmet looks. As a 4th grade teacher I value giving the students a positive role-model to look up to and I feel very proud riding my mountain bike to school wearing this helmet. I have not gotten a chance to test it's impact absorption thankfully, but I feel confident that it will protect the old noodle. I have also not used the full face protection because I have not been on a gnarly enough trail to warrant it, hopefully next year!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Stockie

customer_reviews.title: Very tight for 59 cm head
customer_reviews.text: This is my first full face helmet. Being on the borderline between sizes, I got the Medium size helmet and I kind of wish I got the Large, but full faces should fit snug I suppose. If you can try it on before ordering, do so or definitely measure your head first. To put this on, I have to pry the ears apart while inserting my head which can then slide in. I don't have the chin guard attached while doing this. Taking the helmet off feels like re-experiencing birth going feet first and ears are definitely sore afterwards. I guess this is a good problem to have when you are "wicked smaht" with a big brain to protect.
customer_reviews.author: dog on the internet

customer_reviews.title: The helmet is pretty awesome. Your purchase comes with 2 visors
customer_reviews.text: The helmet is pretty awesome. Your purchase comes with 2 visors, one basic and one that you can attach a camera, like a Go Pro or something. The face mask comes off easily, but not so easily that it will jiggle off on its own. It also comes with replacement cushons in the face portion. Great deal, husband loves it on his long downhill rides where he has to pump alot at the beginning or end.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen

customer_reviews.title: Bad design- chin piece not solidly attached
customer_reviews.text: This came defective. The chin piece is retained by 2 plastic tabs that broke off somewhere along the way of getting to me. It took me a while to figure out why it wasn't clicking into place ...finally dawned upon me that the retaining tabs simply weren't there. I can't image how the chin piece would not break off in an actual impact. Giro makes great helmets but this attachment design needs a rework.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Colors are more washed out in real life
customer_reviews.text: We buy helmets for safety and this one is well rated. Expensive and doesn't look quite like it does in the photo. But again, protecting your noggin is the thing and this helmet has it going for it. I just wish safety like MIPS was not a premium price. Kinda mercenary of them. All that said it fit me well and feels well built with nice features and comfortable (as helmets go).
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: looking like Ronnie Mac the rest of the day and no ...

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, light, sleek
customer_reviews.text: Very comfy and nice design. Haven’t really put it to the complete test but I have full confidence in it. I got a large.. I kind of have a big head at 5’9. Comes with extra visor capable for a go pro, didn’t know that but cool. Also a soft bag. Has the boa style head thing to tighten and extra cheek pads, I think they might be thicker, if so I’m going to put them in. Overall very excited and confident to put it to use

customer_reviews.title: awesome helmet
customer_reviews.text: awesome helmet. I don't mind the "mutton chops" look when I have the chin bar shield off the helmet. I think it looks awesome with some good goggles. But the lid protection is obviously most important. Really cool matte finish and overall is a sweet looking helmet with or without the chin bar.

customer_reviews.title: Huge and Heavy, Like a Tank.(or a dirtbike helmet)
customer_reviews.text: Seems very solid and protective, but its MASSIVE, very heavy. Honestly its about the same as my dirtbike helmet, and uses the same dot strap. It would be great for going down hills...as long as you didn't have to go up em first. Also the pads looked hot glued in there and it arrived with them falling off.
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: Giro to protect all my pretty.
customer_reviews.text: Fits as expected. Does not hinder my ability to hear. Does not cramp my ears like a motorcycle helmet. Did a full face plant on a ride; it protected my face completely. I ride in Texas in 80 + temps, I do not overheat in this helmet. Have not removed the full face piece yet. Will update when I do.

customer_reviews.title: His previous Bell helmet did an excellent job protecting his head but needed replacing
customer_reviews.text: I bought this helmet for my husband after a moderate crash mountain biking. His previous Bell helmet did an excellent job protecting his head but needed replacing. Not only is the Giro Switchblade light weight but it came with the chin bar. Overall feels like a sturdy helmet and fully covers the back of the head. He loves it!

customer_reviews.title: Awesome helmet, great service
customer_reviews.text: Love the helmet, have used it extensively since I purchased it in October. I had a small issue with the brow pad starting to come apart at the seam. I contacted Giro with photos and they sent me a complete set of new pads in less than a week!

customer_reviews.text: I go mountain bike with the family often, so I decided to take precaution with this awesome helmet. It’s ligh & stylish. safety should always be first.

customer_reviews.text: Every tiny detail has been thought through, from the chin strap to the lining. Light, comfortable, and good looking. Highly recommended!

customer_reviews.title: Amazing helmets. My wife and I both have one
customer_reviews.text: Amazing helmets. My wife and I both have one. They vent really well, so unless it is really hot out, they aren't too much of a liability for overheating. Just keep moving to make the vents work :). Fit is excellent, feel very protective, excellent construction and quality. Tops.

Regarding the sizing, I would advise to find a shop who has it, and try it. If you are a recreational rider, or a serious enduro riding it is a very good helmet.

product_meta.title: Giro Switchblade MIPS Adult Dirt Cycling Helmet
feature_bullets: MARKET-LEADING PROTECTION: Engineered in Giro’s category-leading helmet test lab
MIPS: Utilizes the Multi-Directional Impact Protection System to redirect energy in a crash
VENTILATION: Roc Loc Air DH fit system suspends the helmet just slightly off the top of the head allowing airflow to pass over the head and exhaust from the rear
RUGGED AND CERTIFIED: In-mold construction. Meets or exceeds ASTM-1952-DH, CPSC, and EN-1078 standards with & without chinbar
